data.text: Strive not with a mighty man,
Be not at variance with a rich man, lest he overweigh thee:
Strive not with a man that is full of tongue,
Jest not with a rude man,
Reproach not a man that turneth from sin,
Dishonour not a man in his old age:
Rejoice not over thy greatest enemy being dead,
Despise not the discourse of the wise,
Miss not the discourse of the elders:
Kindle not the coals of a sinner,
Rise not up in anger at the presence of an injurious person,
Lend not unto him that is mightier than thyself;
Be not surety above thy power:
Go not to law with a judge;
Travel not by the way with a bold fellow,
Strive not with an angry man,
Do no secret thing before a stranger;
Open not thine heart to every man,
